storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my daily schedule to plan my workday effectively

testCases.title: Validate successful daily schedule display with valid employee login
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Employee has at least one shift scheduled for current day
Web portal is accessible and operational
Database contains valid schedule data for the employee
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the web portal login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials (username and password)
steps.expectedResult: Credentials are accepted without validation errors

steps.action: Click the Login button
steps.expectedResult: Login successful and employee dashboard is displayed within 3 seconds

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the dashboard menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section is accessible and navigation completes successfully

steps.action: Select daily view option
steps.expectedResult: Daily schedule view loads and displays current day's date as header

steps.action: Verify shift details displayed including start time, end time, location, and role
steps.expectedResult: All shift details are displayed correctly and match the employee's scheduled shifts for the current day

steps.action: Click the previous day navigation button
steps.expectedResult: Schedule for the previous day loads within 3 seconds showing correct date and shift information

steps.action: Click the next day navigation button twice
steps.expectedResult: Schedule advances to the next day, then to the day after, loading correctly without errors each time

steps.action: Verify page layout on desktop view
steps.expectedResult: Schedule displays properly with all elements visible and properly formatted for desktop resolution

steps.action: Resize browser window to mobile dimensions or access from mobile device
steps.expectedResult: Schedule adapts to mobile layout with responsive design, all information remains accessible

postconditions: Employee remains logged in
Daily schedule view is displayed
No errors are logged in the system
Session remains active

testCases.title: Verify access restriction for unauthenticated users
preconditions: User is not logged into the system
Web portal is accessible
Direct URL to daily schedule page is known
Valid employee credentials are available for second part of test

steps.action: Open a new browser window or incognito/private browsing session
steps.expectedResult: New browser session opens with no active authentication

steps.action: Attempt to access the daily schedule URL directly (e.g., /schedules/daily) without logging in
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and user is automatically redirected to the login page

steps.action: Verify error message or notification is displayed
steps.expectedResult: System displays appropriate message such as 'Please log in to access this page' or 'Authentication required'

steps.action: Verify the URL has changed to the login page
steps.expectedResult: Browser URL shows login page path, confirming redirect occurred

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials on the login page
steps.expectedResult: Credentials are accepted and validation passes

steps.action: Click the Login button
steps.expectedResult: Login successful and user is redirected to the daily schedule page or dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the daily schedule section if not automatically redirected
steps.expectedResult: Access is granted and daily schedule is displayed with employee's shift information

steps.action: Verify all schedule features are now accessible
steps.expectedResult: Employee can view shifts, navigate between days, and access all schedule functionality

postconditions: User is authenticated and logged in
Access to daily schedule is granted
Security validation is confirmed working
Session is established

testCases.title: Test system behavior when no shifts are scheduled
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system
Employee has access to daily schedule view
There exists at least one date with no scheduled shifts for the employee
System is configured to display appropriate messages for empty schedules

steps.action: Navigate to the daily schedule view from the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Daily schedule view loads successfully

steps.action: Use the date navigation to select a specific day known to have no scheduled shifts
steps.expectedResult: Selected date is displayed in the schedule header

steps.action: Observe the schedule display area for the selected day
steps.expectedResult: System displays a clear message stating 'No scheduled shifts for this day' or similar appropriate message

steps.action: Verify that no shift details (time, location, role) are shown
steps.expectedResult: Schedule area is empty except for the informational message, no placeholder or incorrect data is displayed

steps.action: Verify the page layout remains intact and professional
steps.expectedResult: Page structure is maintained, navigation controls are still visible and functional

steps.action: Navigate to the previous day using the navigation button
steps.expectedResult: System loads the previous day's schedule correctly, showing shifts if available or appropriate message if not

steps.action: Navigate to the next day using the navigation button
steps.expectedResult: System loads the next day's schedule correctly, showing shifts if available or appropriate message if not

steps.action: Return to the day with no shifts and verify message persists
steps.expectedResult: 'No scheduled shifts for this day' message is consistently displayed

postconditions: Employee remains logged in
System correctly handles empty schedule scenario
Navigation functionality remains operational
No errors are generated

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my weekly schedule to plan my workweek efficiently

Employee has multiple shifts scheduled across the current week
Web portal is accessible and operational
Database contains valid weekly schedule data

steps.expectedResult: Login successful and employee dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section loads and displays available view options

steps.action: Select the weekly schedule view option
steps.expectedResult: Weekly schedule view loads within 3 seconds displaying the current week

steps.action: Verify the week date range is displayed in the header (e.g., 'Week of Jan 1 - Jan 7, 2024')
steps.expectedResult: Correct week date range is shown corresponding to the current week

steps.action: Verify all seven days of the week are displayed (Monday through Sunday or Sunday through Saturday based on configuration)
steps.expectedResult: All seven days are visible with proper date labels

steps.action: Review each scheduled shift and verify shift start time is displayed correctly
steps.expectedResult: All shift start times match the expected schedule data for each day

steps.action: Review each scheduled shift and verify shift end time is displayed correctly
steps.expectedResult: All shift end times match the expected schedule data for each day

steps.action: Verify location information is displayed for each shift
steps.expectedResult: Location details are shown and accurate for all scheduled shifts

steps.action: Verify role information is displayed for each shift
steps.expectedResult: Role assignments are shown and accurate for all scheduled shifts

steps.action: Click the previous week navigation button

steps.action: Click the next week navigation button twice
steps.expectedResult: Schedule advances through weeks correctly, loading each week's data within 3 seconds without errors

steps.action: Return to current week view

steps.action: Verify Sunday has visual distinction (different background color, border, or styling)
steps.expectedResult: Sunday is highlighted or styled differently from weekdays, clearly indicating it is a weekend day

steps.action: Navigate to a week that contains a company holiday using the week navigation controls
steps.expectedResult: Weekly schedule loads for the selected week containing a holiday

steps.action: Identify the company holiday date in the weekly schedule
steps.expectedResult: Holiday date is visible in the week view

steps.action: Compare the visual styling of weekends versus holidays versus regular weekdays
steps.expectedResult: Each type (weekend, holiday, weekday) has distinct and easily distinguishable visual styling

steps.expectedResult: Weekend and holiday highlighting remains visible and clear in mobile responsive layout

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section is accessible and displays schedule view options

steps.action: Click the 'Previous Month' navigation button

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to receive confirmation that my schedule is loaded successfully to ensure data accuracy

testCases.title: Validate loading indicator and success confirmation
preconditions: Employee account exists with valid credentials
Employee has scheduled shifts in the system
System is operational and API endpoints are accessible
Employee is logged into the system
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section link is accessible and clickable

steps.action: Click on the schedule view option to request schedule data
steps.expectedResult: Loading indicator (spinner, progress bar, or loading message) is immediately displayed on the screen

steps.action: Observe the loading indicator while schedule data is being fetched
steps.expectedResult: Loading indicator remains visible and animated throughout the data fetch process

steps.action: Wait for the schedule data to load completely
steps.expectedResult: Schedule data loads successfully and is displayed on the screen

steps.action: Verify that a success confirmation message or icon appears after data loads
steps.expectedResult: Success confirmation message (e.g., 'Schedule loaded successfully') or success icon (e.g., green checkmark) is displayed prominently

steps.action: Verify the loading indicator disappears after successful load
steps.expectedResult: Loading indicator is no longer visible once success confirmation is shown

steps.action: Check that the confirmation is visible on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices
steps.expectedResult: Loading indicator and success confirmation are accessible and clearly visible on all supported device types

postconditions: Employee schedule is fully loaded and displayed
Success confirmation has been shown to the user
Loading indicator is no longer visible
Employee remains logged in
System is ready for further interactions

testCases.title: Validate error message on schedule load failure
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system
Test environment allows simulation of API failures or network errors
Employee has permission to access schedule section
System error handling mechanisms are implemented

steps.action: Configure test environment to simulate schedule data load failure (e.g., disconnect network, mock API failure, or use test flag)
steps.expectedResult: Test environment is configured to force a schedule load failure

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section and request schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Loading indicator is displayed as the system attempts to fetch schedule data

steps.expectedResult: System detects the failure to load schedule data

steps.action: Verify the error message is user-friendly and does not expose technical details

steps.action: Check that the loading indicator is replaced by the error message
steps.expectedResult: Loading indicator disappears and error message is prominently displayed

steps.action: Verify error message visibility on different devices (desktop, tablet, mobile)
steps.expectedResult: Error message is clearly visible and accessible on all supported device types

steps.action: Restore normal system configuration
steps.expectedResult: Test environment is returned to normal operational state

postconditions: Error message has been displayed to the employee
Loading indicator is no longer visible
Employee remains logged in
System is ready for retry or other actions
Test environment is restored to normal configuration

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to access my schedule securely to protect my personal and work information

testCases.title: Validate authentication requirement for schedule access
preconditions: Employee account exists in the system with valid credentials
Application is deployed and accessible
User is not currently logged in
Browser cache and cookies are cleared
Direct schedule URL is known

steps.action: Open a new browser window or incognito/private browsing session
steps.expectedResult: New browser session opens with no active authentication

steps.action: Enter the direct URL to the schedule page in the address bar (e.g., https://app.example.com/schedule)
steps.expectedResult: Browser attempts to navigate to the schedule URL

steps.action: Press Enter to navigate to the schedule URL
steps.expectedResult: System detects unauthenticated access attempt and redirects to the login page instead of displaying the schedule

steps.action: Verify that the login page is displayed and the schedule is not accessible
steps.expectedResult: Login page is shown with username and password fields, schedule content is not visible

steps.action: Enter valid employee username in the username field
steps.expectedResult: Username is accepted and displayed in the field

steps.action: Enter valid employee password in the password field
steps.expectedResult: Password is masked and accepted in the field

steps.action: Click the 'Login' or 'Sign In' button
steps.expectedResult: System authenticates the credentials successfully

steps.action: Verify redirection after successful login
steps.expectedResult: User is redirected to their personal schedule page, displaying only their own schedule data

steps.action: Verify that the schedule content is now visible and accessible
steps.expectedResult: Employee's schedule is fully displayed with all expected schedule information visible

postconditions: Employee is successfully authenticated and logged in
Employee has access to their own schedule only
Session is established and active
No unauthorized access occurred

testCases.title: Test session timeout after inactivity
preconditions: Employee account exists in the system with valid credentials
Application is deployed and accessible
Session timeout is configured to 15 minutes of inactivity
User is not currently logged in
Timer or clock is available to track 15 minutes

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with authentication fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials and click login
steps.expectedResult: Authentication succeeds and user is logged into the application

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section
steps.expectedResult: Employee's schedule is displayed and accessible

steps.action: Note the current time and remain completely inactive (no mouse movements, clicks, or keyboard input)
steps.expectedResult: Session remains active, schedule remains visible

steps.action: Wait for exactly 15 minutes without any user interaction
steps.expectedResult: 15 minutes of inactivity elapses with no user actions performed

steps.action: After 15 minutes, attempt to interact with the schedule (e.g., click on a schedule item or navigation element)
steps.expectedResult: Session has expired, user is automatically logged out and redirected to the login page

steps.action: Verify that the login page is displayed and a session timeout message is shown
steps.expectedResult: Login page is visible with a message indicating the session expired due to inactivity

steps.action: Verify that attempting to use the browser back button does not restore access to the schedule
steps.expectedResult: Back button either returns to login page or shows an error, schedule remains inaccessible without re-authentication

postconditions: User session is terminated
User is logged out of the application
Schedule is no longer accessible without re-authentication
Session timeout mechanism is confirmed to be working correctly

testCases.title: Verify HTTPS enforcement
preconditions: Application is deployed with HTTPS configured
SSL/TLS certificates are properly installed
HTTP to HTTPS redirect is configured on the server
Browser supports HTTPS
User is not currently logged in

steps.action: Open a new browser window
steps.expectedResult: Browser window opens successfully

steps.action: In the address bar, type the HTTP version of the schedule URL (e.g., http://app.example.com/schedule) ensuring 'http://' is explicitly used
steps.expectedResult: HTTP URL is entered in the address bar

steps.action: Press Enter to attempt navigation to the HTTP URL
steps.expectedResult: Browser attempts to connect using HTTP protocol

steps.action: Observe the URL in the address bar after the page loads
steps.expectedResult: Connection is automatically redirected from HTTP to HTTPS, URL in address bar changes to 'https://app.example.com/schedule' or shows HTTPS with a padlock icon

steps.action: Verify the presence of the security padlock icon in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: Padlock icon is visible, indicating a secure HTTPS connection is established

steps.action: Click on the padlock icon to view connection details
steps.expectedResult: Connection information shows the connection is secure, certificate is valid, and HTTPS protocol is being used

steps.action: Attempt to access other application pages using HTTP protocol
steps.expectedResult: All HTTP requests are automatically redirected to HTTPS, maintaining secure connection throughout

postconditions: All connections to the application use HTTPS protocol
HTTP to HTTPS redirect is functioning correctly
Secure connection is maintained for all pages
No insecure HTTP connections are allowed
